msItem.note: - The Gädlä Yasay is still an unpublished text.
- On fol. 29va ls.1-2, the 9th of Mäskäräm is mentioned as the dies natalis of ʾabba Yasay.

- On fol. 29va, the text ends with a subscriptio (ለዘ፡ አጽሐፎ፡ ለዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ወልደ፡ ማርያም፡ ወለዘአንበቦ፡ ወለጸሐፎ፡ ኅቡረ፡ … ይምሐሮሙ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡…) which is a supplication for the commissioner of the Ms., Wäldä Maryam, and for the reader, the scribe, the translator and the one who have listened to its story.

The note is written in black and red (reddish-brown) ink by the same secondary hand as that of Additio 2. It states that the Ms. was donated to the church (tabot) of ʾabunä Yasay Dǝrba by däğğazmač Gugsa, whose baptismal name is Wäldä Maryam. Beside him some of his relatives are mentioned: his father Gäbrä Ṣadǝq, his grandfather (the father of his father) Wäldä Śǝllase. The name of his mother is missing. Again, the note states that däğğazmač Gugsa, who came originally from ʾAgwǝʾdi, a place called Hangwäda, commissioned the writing of the Ms. in the year of mercy 1903 in time of Mark the Evangelist (= 1910 A.D.; cp. ChChron 172), while he was in the region of Šäwa; from there he sent the Ms. to Hangwäda and after he died his children sent it to Dǝrba. Some lines at the beginning of the note are erased.

- Stamp (violet) in fol. 1v. - Crude notes (by a recent hand and in pen) in the margins of fols. 3r, 13v, 15v, 20v, 21r, 26r, 30r. - Omitted letters or words written interlineally on several fols.: e.g., fols. 5r, 8v, 9v, 10v, 11r, 12v, 25r, 27r.

origin.origDate: 1903 A.M. (= 1910 A.D.) The date 1903 A.M. and the time of Mark the Evangelist (= 1910 A.D., cp. ChChron 172) are mentioned in Additio 3 as the time when the Ms. was commissioned by däğğazmač Gugsa.
